DataElement.preferredName: Female Puberty Pubic Hair Development Tanner Scale Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the stage of pubic hair development in females, referencing the Tanner scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._The stage in life when sex glands become functional.  It is characterized by the development of secondary sex characteristics, reproductive functions, and growth spurts._Hair in the frontal genital area, the crotch, and sometimes at the top of the inside of the legs; these areas form the pubic region._Development is the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.:The stage in life when sex glands become functional.  It is characterized by the development of secondary sex characteristics, reproductive functions, and growth spurts.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
The stage in life when sex glands become functional. It is characterized by the development of secondary sex characteristics, reproductive functions, and growth spurts.

Property.preferredDefinition: Vo value exists.:Development is the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

Concepts.definition: Hair growing in the pubic area.
The act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Female Pubic Hair Development Tanner Scale Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both._Hair growing in the pubic area._Development is the act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage._A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 1 - Prepubertal, villus hair only

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 1, Female
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vellus hair develops over the pubes in a manner not greater than that over the anterior wall. There is no sexual hair.

Concepts.longName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 1, Female
Concepts.definition: Vellus hair develops over the pubes in a manner not greater than that over the anterior wall. There is no sexual hair.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 2 - Sparse growth of slightly pigmented hair along the labia

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 2, Female
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sparse, long, pigmented, downy hair, which is straight or only slightly curled, appears. These hairs are seen mainly along the labia. This stage is difficult to quantitate on black and white photographs, particularly when pictures are of fair-haired subjects.

Concepts.longName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 2, Female
Concepts.definition: Sparse, long, pigmented, downy hair, which is straight or only slightly curled, appears. These hairs are seen mainly along the labia. This stage is difficult to quantitate on black and white photographs, particularly when pictures are of fair-haired subjects.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 3 - Hair is coarser, curled and pigmented; spreads across the pubes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 3, Female
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Considerably darker, coarser, and curlier sexual hair appears. The hair has now spread sparsely over the junction of the pubes.

Concepts.longName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 3, Female
Concepts.definition: Considerably darker, coarser, and curlier sexual hair appears. The hair has now spread sparsely over the junction of the pubes.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 4 - Adult-type hair but no spread to medial thigh

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 4, Female
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The hair distribution is adult in type but decreased in total quantity. There is no spread to the medial surface of the thighs.

Concepts.longName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 4, Female
Concepts.definition: The hair distribution is adult in type but decreased in total quantity. There is no spread to the medial surface of the thighs.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Tanner Stage 5 - Adult-type hair with spread to medial thigh but not up linea alba

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 5, Female
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hair is adult in quantity and type and appears to have an inverse triangle of the classically feminine type. There is spread to the medial surface of the thighs but not above the base of the inverse triangle.

Concepts.longName: Tanner Pubic Hair Development Stage 5, Female
Concepts.definition: Hair is adult in quantity and type and appears to have an inverse triangle of the classically feminine type. There is spread to the medial surface of the thighs but not above the base of the inverse triangle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

Concepts.definition: A person who belongs to the sex that normally produces ova. The term is used to indicate biological sex distinctions, or cultural gender role distinctions, or both.
Hair growing in the pubic area.
The act, or process, of natural progression in physical and psychological maturation from a previous, lower, or embryonic stage to a later, more complex, or adult stage.

A scale of physical development in children, adolescents and adults based on external primary and secondary sex characteristics, such as the size of the breasts, genitalia, and development of pubic hair.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
